channel.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
channel.description:
I bought a drip coffee pot similar to this one: [img]http://img.diytrade.com/cdimg/699553/9828408/0/1248335970/Drip_coffee_maker.jpg[/img]
At the supermarket there's a million different types of coffee powder. Which type of coffee am I supposed to use with this machine?
Is arabica coffee appropriate?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

well yeah i didnt mean instant

never seen nescafe in a tin either, only the glass things lol

then again i dont pay much attention to instant coffee lifes too short!

Read full topic

item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Radeon, post:9, topic:341643”]That’s the one I’m talking about R.I.P RSC but unfortunately it’s not the normal way they make coffee here. Everyone drinks arabic/turkish coffee here.

Every time I go to the supermarket they have a huge variety of coffee and not a single one of them is plain coffee. Now I’m wondering, the coffee for this type of machine is supposed to have a certain texture to it right? With all the varieties I’ve tried so far, some of them are fine powder and some of them are much more course. How is the coffee for this machine supposed to be?[/quote]

Coffee filter, any type of shit you see at the supermarket inside that, then water. Its really not as hard as you think. Unless you are trying to put beans in the coffee maker, you have to grind those up first.

Read full topic
item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:13, topic:341643"][quote author=Uriko link=topic=438044.msg3221225#msg3221225 date=1275183338]
meh, folgers sucks. i would rather buy coffee beans and grind them myself
[/quote]

My grandma drinks Folgers, it’s cheap and disgusting. I usually just go to Tim Hortons and buy myself a tin, it’s not that expensive and i would rather have it than Folgers.[/quote]

Out of the cheaper brands, it’s not so bad really. I wouldn’t say it’s disgusting, but it’s not as good as tim hortons etc

item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

That’s the one I’m talking about R.I.P RSC but unfortunately it’s not the normal way they make coffee here. Everyone drinks arabic/turkish coffee here.

Every time I go to the supermarket they have a huge variety of coffee and not a single one of them is plain coffee. Now I’m wondering, the coffee for this type of machine is supposed to have a certain texture to it right? With all the varieties I’ve tried so far, some of them are fine powder and some of them are much more course. How is the coffee for this machine supposed to be?

Read full topic
item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

That’s just an ordinary coffeemaker right? Isn’t that the normal way to make coffee in your country? You just put a filter in the top thing, fill it with ground coffee, fill the other thing with water and press ‘on’. Sara lee has some good coffee brands. Here in the Netherlands we mainly use Douwe Egberts or Kanis & Gunnik.

Read full topic
item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?

item.title: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
item.dc:creator: @mikehershey mikehershey
item.description:
@mikehershey wrote:

You can use any type of coffee grinds you like I take it your not American every grocery store has like half an isle of coffee beans that u can grind fresh. If you have options go for columbian if not just find a cheap thing of folgers. Columbian seems pretty hard to mess up even week old columbian coffee is drinkable

Read full topic
item.source: What type of coffee to use with coffeemaker?
